website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality dispenser that cuts down on measuring spoons, although some buyers feel it is over-thinking a simple product.
pros: Unique design that pumps oil into the measuring cap top before dispensing
cons: Some durability issues with the pump failing after a few weeks, and the side buttons falling off

customer_reviews.title: Works well for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a great idea at first, but eventually the bottle started leaking oil out the top and sides. Then it wouldn't reliably pump the same amount of oil into the top container. Then it wouldn't reliably pour what was in the top container out. So I'm unfortunately tossing this out and going back to having olive oil bottles on our counter again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B. Paul

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate measurements
customer_reviews.text: It generally works well - the squueze buttons are a bit awkward, but relatively easy to use; the tube reaches nearly to the bottom, so most of the oil is used; and the poring feature is well placed and balanced. However, the measurements are inaccurate, as the oil pours not just from the reservoir at the top, but also freely from the tube, resulting in major overpours. For example, I measured 1 Tbsp into the reservoir, poured it into a 1 Tbsp measuring spoon and stopped when it was full - which left what registered as 1/2 Tbsp in the reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn L. Garrison
